source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sepals distinctly hairy externally; anthers distinctly bifid apically and basally; flowers often 2 per peduncle
Sepals glabrous externally (rarely with a few scattered hairs in var. hygrometrica); anthers bifid basally, entire or emarginate apically; flowers usually single
Anthers versatile; stigma lobes much shorter than slender non-stigmatic portion of style
Anthers erect; stigma lobes sub-equal in length to stout, non-stigmatic portion of style
